nodes.bodyText: What is this for?
Thanks for highlighting this point ,I have removed this.activeLinkIndex = this.navLinks.indexOf(navLink);
If the URL doesn't match any of the navLinks how did we get to this page?

I have added this code for hiding navBar in studyDetails, siteDetails and appDetails page and we will be having custom back button in studyDetails, siteDetails and appDetails pages to come back to dashboard page
I think I'd rather always have the navbar. A back button assumes the users always want to go to the studies list page again before, say apps, which I don't think is a great experience.
Yeah but according to the Invision diagram we need to hide the  navbar in the details page ,I have attched the invision screen of study details (study participant list ) page for your refrence,
I don't know how your design process works, but I would expect things to change as we implement them. It's just my opinion though, if someone disagrees we can keep it as-is
Dashboard isn't the right name for this. It isn't the data for displaying a dashboard (as far as I can tell).

nodes.bodyText: This test doesn't really add anything. Please remove.
Removed.
There isn't any search box in this component. Please remove
Search Box will be part of sitecoordinator.component.html and it is a commonHeader for all the child components,We have removed this test case
tests should be all lowercase. should display all studies
Updated.

What if it isn't an ApiResponse? I ran into this issue with the page not loading. You should fall back to another error message if something else went wrong. I would also extract this into an HttpInterceptor, because I'm sure you're going to want to do this on every HTTP request
Updated the HttpInterceptor,Please check and let us know if any other error needs to be handled

Use optional chaining instead
study.name?.toLowerCase()?.includes(query.toLowerCase())
Changing it to the above code is giving error as mentioned in the image
Well if it isn't nullable then you don't need either. If it's an empty check the includes will always fail, so you don't need it in that case either.
Exceptions aren't very common in TS? What are you expecting to be thrown here?
Site should be in its own file.
Remove empty attribute.
